Package edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre.util

Class MemoryBudget

java.lang.Object
edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre.util.MemoryBudget
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class MemoryBudget extends Object implements Serializable
A memory budget is used to track how much memory a data structure has used and prevent it from going over a defined limit. This object simply a counter that will throw an OutOfMemoryError when it is asked for memory beyond its limit. A memory budget can be serialized, but it will not retain information about how much memory has been used; when deserialized, it will assume no memory has yet been used.
Author:
Stephen G. Ware

    • getRemaining

      public long getRemaining()
      Returns the number of bytes remaining in this budget, or Long.MAX_VALUE if this budget is unlimited.
      Returns:
      the bytes remaining or Long.MAX_VALUE

    • reduce

      public long reduce(long bytes)
      Reduces the budget by the given amount (or as much as it can without going below 0) or throws an exception if the budget is completely exhausted.
      Parameters:
      bytes - the number of bytes to reduce the budget by
      Returns:
      the number of bytes the budget was reduced by, which may be less than the requested amount if the requested amount was higher than the remaining budget
      Throws:
      OutOfMemoryError - if the budget was already exhausted when this method was called

    • toString

      public static final String toString(long bytes)
      Returns a string representation of a number of bytes using abbreviations to approximate large amounts:
      • B for 1 byte
      • k for 1000 bytes
      • M for 1000 k
      • G for 1000 M
      • T for 1000 G
      • P for 1000 T
      • E for 1000 P
      The string returned may not be an exact representation of the number. For example, 5002000 will be represented as "5M" even though it is actually 2k more than that.

      This formatting can also used by this constructor.

      Parameters:
      bytes - the number of bytes to convert to a string
      Returns:
      the string or "unlimited" if the number given is less than or equal to 0

    • parse

      public static final long parse(String string)
      Converts a string representation of an amount of memory into a number of bytes. This method uses the same formating as toString(long).
      Parameters:
      string - the number of bytes as a string
      Returns:
      the number of bytes as a number
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the string cannot be parsed
